basics.name: Sreyas Adiraju
basics.summary: Graduating senior at Columbia University studying Neuroscience and Applied Mathematics, with research interests in computational neuroscience, biological machine learning, and artificial intelligence.

education.studyType: Bachelors of Arts, Neuroscience and Behavior & Applied Mathematics
education.area: Phi Beta Kappa, Dean’s List (2021–Present), I.I. Rabi Scholar,        GPA: 4.0599
education.courses: Neurobiology I & II, Neurogenetics, Cognitive Neuroscience, Statistical Inference, Probability Theory, Analysis I & II, Dynamical Systems, Topology, Philosophy of Science

work.name: Issa Lab, Zuckerman Institute, Columbia University
work.summary: Research in visual self-supervised learning and neural representations.
highlights: Developed latent-space predictive models over egocentric and allocentric motion
Trained deep neural networks in PyTorch and probed representational geometry
Created ImageNet-scale dataset of parametric naturalistic scenes
Designed experimental stimuli for marmoset viewing experiments

work.name: LMU Munich - Astrophysics, Cosmology, and Artificial Intelligence
work.summary: Research in deep learning for cosmological parameter inference.
highlights: Built 1D CNN architecture for modeling Lyman-alpha forest absorption spectra
Inferred posterior distributions over thermal parameters using deep learning
Trained and tuned models in TensorFlow/Keras

work.name: Columbia University
work.summary: Teaching assistantships in neuroscience and applied mathematics.
highlights: BIOL 3005 (Neurobiology II): Led recitations on research papers and organized exam reviews
APMA 4101 (Dynamical Systems): Held office hours, graded homework and exams, supported course instruction

awards.title: Honorable Mention - Mathematical Contest in Modeling
